Class MainViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.MainViewController
public class MainViewController extends Object
The MainViewController class is responsible for managing the main view of the application.

This class loads and displays a grid of movie cards and handles user interactions such as signing out. It primarily interacts with the movieGridPane to display movie information and utilizes the MovieService singleton to retrieve the list of movies. It uses FXML annotations for initializing and managing UI elements.

  • Field Details

    • aMovieGridPane

      private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane aMovieGridPane
      Represents a grid pane used to display a collection of movies in the main view. This field is linked to the FXML file associated with the MainViewController and is used to create a structured layout of movie-related components or information. The grid pane is populated dynamically with movie data, where each movie is represented as a visual component within the pane. It allows seamless organization and presentation of movies in a grid-based arrangement. This field is initialized and managed as part of the application's user interface for displaying movies to the user.

    • aMovieService

      private final MovieService aMovieService
      Represents a singleton instance of the MovieService class, which provides centralized management of movie-related data within the application. This variable is used by the MainViewController to populate and interact with the list of movies displayed in the user interface. It allows access to the movie data and supports operations such as retrieving, adding, and removing movies.

    • aUiService

      private final UIService aUiService

  • Constructor Details

    • MainViewController

      public MainViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the main view controller. This method is automatically invoked when the associated FXML is loaded. It prepares the view by populating the grid with movie cards using the current list of movies provided by the movieService.

    • populateGrid

      private void populateGrid(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> pMovies)
      Populates the grid pane with movie cards based on the provided list of pMovies. Each movie is represented as a card created from an FXML template. The grid is cleared before populating it with the new set of movie cards.
      Parameters:
      pMovies - the list of pMovies to be displayed in the grid. If the list is null or empty, the grid will not be populated.

    • onSignOutButtonClick

      private void onSignOutButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the sign out button click event. Opens the login view and closes the current window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the sign out button
